course.subject: UROP
course.name: Undergraduate Research Opportunities with Mini-conference Experience
course.description: This course provides a platform on which students can gain hands-on research experience and have a continued Undergraduate Research Opportunities Program (UROP) experience by taking the same research project or different project led by the same faculty supervisor. Students are required to participate in a mini- conference to deliver project presentations and to submit a final report. Approval by faculty supervisor(s) is required. Graded P or F.
course.prerequisites: (TWO passing grades in UROP 1100) OR (a passing grade in UROP 1100 and UROP 2100)
